caption: It’s like the Manhattan location if no one yelled at you and the payment/ordering system wasn’t designed by someone who grew up drinking lead-contaminated water. Who knew you could operate a deli without bouncers? Crazy. Sandwich was a 10.
Very gd pastrami
A pastrami sandwich you’ll never forget!

We ordered hot dogs and macaroni salad. The hot dogs were extremely salty. I expect hot dogs to be salty but these were so salty, I ended up not eating my second one. The macaroni salad was very creamy and seasoned well.
The pastrami sandwich is worth the wait.
FIVE PEOPLE IN THE THE STORE  NOR GOOD ATTENTION OK THE FAT GIDE ITS THE GENTLEMAN ITS NOT SERVICE COSTUMER SERVICE
Was DISAPPOINTED!!!!! nothing like One In Manhattan.  98% of my pastrami on my Reuben was nothing but fat.  I basically had nothing to eat and ended up wasting 30$ !!!! AVOID THIS PLACE
Over rated, not as large sandwiches as the pics suggest, expensive
Best damn pastrami in New York City

Zero stars. Got a combo sandwich with pastrami and brisket for dinner and was super disappointed. Neither meat was hot. And the brisket was dry as hell, I've probably had better brisket at an all you can eat buffet when I was a kid unfortunately.
Great tastes. Helpful clerk.

Quick service and authentic New York City eats. Everything from the hot dogs to the pastrami sandwiches is a top notch choice. The staff at this Citypoint outpost of Katz’s Deli is truly a blessing for Brooklyn.
Thanks for the great pastrami sandwich and matzo soup!!  Nice to see young workers with great work ethic, two thumbs up!

I ordered the pastrami sandwich and matzo ball soup. Both were outstanding and I would order again. While waiting for my food, the guy preparing my order gave me a huge sample of the pastrami. Great customer service and delicious food.
perfect delicious

I came to Katz in Gold St. In Brooklyn  NY. You need better customer service help because the Person (Boy) was very unprofessional and no Customer Service skills. That's not how you keep People coming back.
Best pastrami in the world.

$24.00 for a Pastrami on rye.  I expected so much more.. The meat was salty, dry. & cold.  And the bread was hard.  Very disappointed.  I'll  stick with Juniors... btw: the Katz in Manhattan is SO MUCH BETTER than this one. They're not living up to the GREAT reputation of the Katz brand.
Best brisket around
been going to Katz's since the eightys, getting the pastrami sandwich. Love it , including the chopped liver and split pea soup.  Planning a way to get there from the Bronx .  C u soon Katz.
Great Pastrami !
Its outside. All you have to do is order and they will bring it.
They do not offer service at the counter at this location.

We we so excited to check this place. We were racially profiled,ignored, and had awful service. Prices are outrageous for little we got. No rye bread. Little sandwiches. Small portions for $35. Employees are providing service based  on race. We were number 703,ignored,they were calling number 706 without calling us at all. There were only 2groups of customers by number; 706 and 703. They pretended we were not there until we said something. Chinatown eateries, here we come!
For me. Too much. That explains why American are just a bit obese. Just too much Sorry, got a be honest sometimes

Had a decent pastrami sandwich but I have to say I had better before. They seem struggle keeping the same level of quality as in their iconic location in Manhattan. Te pastrami was quite thickly cut and dry. I didn't have time to go back to Manhattan and have this one a shot.
The service was great but the sandwich was horrible, not what I expected as I ve frequented Katz in the past , meat was tough and a lot of fat, I asked for thinly sliced and it was thick as ever
Pastrami sandwich is as good as the one they serve in the city. Highly recommend.
Katz’s deli has the best pastrami in the world! That is no lie.

Had the Reuben sandwich with pastrami, and it was easily the best sandwich I've ever had. half of a sandwich was plenty filling, which made the price more reasonable when split between two people. Could not recommend the pastrami and pickles enough, both were so full of flavor an depth
Bklyn 's Katz's can't be compared at all to the original. They don't listen and they mess up orders. My heart is still with Manhattan , the best.
So happy Katz's opened up another deli stand in Brooklyn, food taste the same.

Katz's Deli Gift Packages I remember going to Katz's Deli since as a child with my grandparents. The smell of the pickles and the food made you drool before you even sat down. Forward many many years later, I have beenfortunate enough to receive at least two gift packages from my brother for me and my daughter. I have also sent gift packages to dear friends as a very special gift. Katz's Deli offers different packages with classic Jewish offerings. I have had their matzo ball soup which will cure anything from the common cold to the flu.The matzo balls are fluffy and flavorful. My daughter even liked them better than mine. The pastrami was wonderful. Sliced perfectly against the grain, thick and flavorful, makes the perfect sandwich topped with the epic mustard from the deli. The pickles were amazing. Crunchy and boosting that perfect sour flavor are the perfect compliment to the luscious pastrami. The knishes are so tasty and filling. Baked to a crisp crust, they are just fantastic. And of course you must have dessert. The babka was just outstanding. Layers of flaky pastry with chocolate swirls were just melt in your mouth deliciousness. I also loved the apron that comes in this gift package. I have sent gift packages and the tee shirts are wonderful.Any gift package that you order from Katz's Deli comes straight from Kat's Deli. They do not go through any 3rd party organization.  When a company has been in business since 1888, there are many reasons. Location to a community that services their type of cuisine is very important. Secondly the food must be superb and consistently superb, which of course is Katz's Deli. And lastly it must have wonderful customer service. This is Katz's Deli to the max. They go to the sky to make sure every order is perfect and if not, correct it without hesitation. This is how Katz's Deli has been around since 1888 and I hope for many many more years to come.
Really good sandwich. A bit expensive but worth it

If you’re going for the pastrami, avoid the disappointment of this place & just go to the original Katz on Houston (Manhattan). I was hoping this location would be just as good but unfortunately it wasn’t - meat was dry and less flavorful.

Probably the best pastrami and swiss I've had in a long, long time. The mustard is the best I've ever had. Not a fan of the pickles, they're still too cutecumber tasting for me. I like a really good dill flavor. Makes me wish we had these where I'm from.
dekalb katz no good

For a $26 rueben sandwich you’d think you’ll be eating something special. But instead there’s disappointment and confusion in every bite. Why is it so overpriced; why did I think it’ll taste out of this world? Reevaluating my whole life now as we speak.  The corned beef was so salty I had to down a bottle of water.

I ordered  a corned beef sandwich. It was the worst corned beef sandwich i have ever had and it was $23... It was just corned beef and white bread. This is a crime! It tasted like fish. I am from Los Angeles and I was excited to get a New York corned beef sandwich and this place was a huge bust.

Dry, fatty, overpriced meat. Only slightly less dry than sawdust. I paid nearly $50 and I'm upset about it. I'm never going to Katz again. I've been disappointed in its original location too many times, I had high hopes for the new location. This marks my first (and last) experience at Dekalb ave.
Awesome !!!!! Awesome !!!!! Need I say more.

(Translated by Google) Very satisfied with the taste! It was nice to have a store in this place. The information that Katz's Delicatessen store in Lower East Side is very crowded and I didn't have the time to go there during my stay, but I can enjoy the popular pastrami sand easily.  (Original) 味にとても満足！この場所に店舗ができてくれて良かった。Lower East SideのKatz's Delicatessen店舗はとても混んでいるという情報と、滞在中行く時間がなかったけれど、人気のパストラミサンドを手軽に味わう事ができて最高！
Boyfriend says it was a great tasting! Definitely pricey. This was above $20 but seemingly worth it as a once in a blue purchase.

Brisket and pastrami sandwiches were excellent best sandwich we had in New York.  Waitress left a lot to be desired but hey that seems kinda like part of the charm.  I would recommend if you want a huge sandwich that satisfies.  Unique environment that’s kinda fun.

So, so, so overpriced. Their hot dog has a very thick skin that is very difficult to bite through. I had trouble with it and was concerned it presented a choking risk for my young child (who I don't worry about, but that's how tough the casing was on this hot dog). Quality of the food is nothing special at this location. There are many other better options at DeKalb Market Hall although it can be difficult to find something reasonable for a young, picky eater. Katz is not a good option.
Same great quality as the original location.
Just the best. Sandwiches are just incredible
Delish
The best pastrami sandwich in New York so far. It's delicious.
A new york classic. Huge portion, can feed 2. Is quite pricey
Awesome pastrami!
Food was excellent
So great, so much pastrami
Too expensive...

It’s 1/2 of the original. So 2.5 stars. Friendly service but location sucks. Food portion not the same. However price is just as much. Rather it stand alone as to be in a Food court. Would not recommend ppl to go to BKLYN location. Sorry not Sorry
The price jumped from last year.. $15.00 to $21.00 this year.  Two sandwiches $50.00. I'll stick to Junior's! Great Food, decent prices!
(Translated by Google) Delicious!  (Original) Delicioso!
Best kept secret to skip the katz craziness and get the flavor.
Great food. Person serving was not friendly and more concerned with his mobile phone than providing good service.
The pastrami sandwich is good, I just felt is a little overpriced

(Translated by Google) Without a doubt the biggest sandwiches I have ever eaten. Very complete, although difficult to eat for that, but very rich.  (Original) Sin duda los sandwiches mas grandes que he comido nunca. Muy completos, aunque dificiles de comer por eso, pero muy ricos.

Big fan of original katz on Houston street and Ludlow. Haven't been there for a while so wanted to try but couldn't go to the original location because of the weather and traffic in Manhattan so went to the Brooklyn location. Really disappointed with the service and food. The workers with bad manner and food horrible. The meat was so rusty and cold. Really didn't expect the food would be like this comparing to original location. U let me down to my family. Thank you

2 stars just because the food was great but the employees are rude and very impatient I get that they’re busy but that’s no excuse to treat people in that manner especially if we’re paying over 20 dollars for a sandwich

A wonderful sandwich.  This is a spin off from the original store on NYs lower East Side. The sandwich is a bit expensive but the amount of meat is amazing. The staff are personable and knowledgeable.i loved it 40 years ago and it is equally as good in this new location. There are stool sitting places plus tables in the food court.
Classic Katz without the annoying lines!
I ate the food. I got very sick. It was very high in sodium. I was having a stroke.

I was excited to try this place as the meat looked awesome in pictures and in person. I asked for a pastrami sandwich with cheese, dressing and coleslaw. The meat was AWESOME, which is why I even gave it 3 stars. However there was barley any coleslaw on it, the bread fell apart on my 2nd bite because it was so thin and the sandwich was extremely expensive. $27 for what you see in my picture.
Very disappointed. Dry stale potato knish. Go to Manhattan Katz Deli!!!!
Best cornbeef sandwich

They are located in the basement of the City Point mall along with a bunch of other foodie spots. I Ordered a steaming hot Pastrami on Rye made fatty with deli mustard. They also gave me a nice helping of pickles and container of more deli mustard. Got there around 2 pm, no line and very friendly service by the woman at the cashier. She acknowledged I was friendly too and knew I must be from out of town, LOL. The sandwich is expensive but worth it since I'm not in NYC often and the quality of pastrami with the fatty cuts are the best I've had. Watching the cutters slice the meat and lay it out on the bread like a spread out deck of cards was satisfying. Since it was around the corner from my hotel it was easier for me to go here than the regular spot.

The location is not that far from East Houston Street but they are so far apart on many other levels, if you ever went to Houston Street don't ever go to DeKalb Avenue. it's a different experience the staff needs to be retrained in customer service personal hygiene and mental health, the food was subpar and of all things they was using gulden's mustard. They didn't offer me a taste of the meat so when I asked about it they looked at me like who you talkin to.
Expensive but good
(Translated by Google) Must have tasted! An institution in New York City!  (Original) Muss man probiert haben! Eine Institution in New York City!

Had a lunch sandwich here with a business associate. Food was good but I wish they had given better descriptions of the food or asked me what type I wanted as I had a meat that was less fatty than I usually like. Overall very good.
Best food ever
(Translated by Google) Prices far above average for sandwiches ....  (Original) Prezzi molto al di sopra della media per dei panini ....

Katz Deli in brooklyn is now skimping on the sandwich you get half of what you normally would get at the original Katz Deli.so you getting half of a sandwich and being charged the full price of a normal sandwich. Otherwise the sandwiches look like
Great matzah ball soup.
Overrated
Pastrami on rye

Been to both and this pales in comparison to the original. Go to that one if you really want a good sandwich. If you're staying in Brooklyn go to Mile End on Hoyt instead. It's only a few blocks away.

(Translated by Google) The cost performance is not very good... the bread is bad! It was served as a piece of meat, but I expected it because it was delicious, but since there are no vegetables, it may not be suitable for Korean tastes.  (Original) 가성비는 별로고 .. 빵이 맛이없어요! 고기 한점 서비스로 주는데 맛있어서 기대했는데 야채가 없으니 한국인 입맛엔 좀 안맞을수도있을거 같습니다 .
Make sure you tip or you will get a stale frank. Bad for business!

I love this place! Sqaw Bread is the way to go. It is so soft and delicious. Everything on their menu is fantastic. It is a small shop, not a lot of parking but it is great place to stop by if you can.

(Translated by Google) Iconic shop with huge sandwiches at very high prices ... about $ 20 a sandwich. I just wanted to see and try it ... I have it now. The sandwiches were ok ... but don't have to go back again  (Original) Kultladen mit riesigen Sandwiches zu sehr hohen Preisen ...ca.20 Dollar ein Sandwich. Ich wollte es einfach mal sehen und probieren...hab ich jetzt.  Die Sandwiches waren ok....muss aber nicht zwangsläufig nochmal hin
Cat meat wasnt so good ive had better definitely wont be back here

I tried katz's deli. I was with the illusion from the review on YouTube that this was the best pastrami in nyc. Pastrami was dry and warm cold. I should have ask them to put it in the microwave. It got cold from the pick up section to about 10 feet to the nearest table. These workers were talking to the cleaning staff insted to the customers. Mite be of an help to aske the customer do you want it hot can i make it better to your liking. Something. Dam now i have to find my father's pastrami spot in Manhattan around 50 th st on the west side. There they pull out the pastrami from a hot steamy bath and cut it on the slicer and it be nice and tender and hot. The only thing i enjoy was the 12oz pepsi and the green pickle with the mustard. Ill give kayz a second chance at 205 east on houston St on my next vacation
Large portions, tons of meat in the sandwiches but the meat is not as moist as from their other location.
The food is good but it kind of stings to pay $20 for a sandwich at a food court instead of the original location. You do get a lot of sandwich for that money, though.
Well the meat is tender and juicy and good but I’m Very disappointed by the price. Twenty-freaking-three dollars for a sandwich? Are u for real guys? I just wanted a sandwich and not the whole store!
Can't wait to go there, love the one in the city, hope this one is great as well...
Go to the main store in Manhattan this place is not worth the 20.00 for the sandwich
I got a brisket sandwich at the DeKalb location and it was 95% fat and 5% brisket on bread. This is disgusting and a waste of money.
Just not the same as the original. Very disappointing.

It’s not only the most expensive vendor in the market, but also it brings disgrace to the glorious legacy Katz created in NYC/the US. Was very excited after years of hype, only to be let down with soggy bread & pastrami dry as sand.

Food and price are consistent to original location … that's right the SAME PRICE, which is totally fair, and I get it, but also, you're in a food court with zero atmosphere, right next to the entrance/exit of Trader Joes … $20 is a bit steep for the location and it possibly wasn't the best expansion shout for them.

By far, the worst corned beef and pastrami sandwich I've ever had.  Im no stranger to the original location.  It's amazing.  But this sandwich today from the counter they have at 1dekalb Ave was 70% grizzle and fat.  I can't believe they put those slices on my $25 (I even tipped) sandwich.  I couldn't even chew through it to get a bite.  Never again.

My first visit to katz was very disappointing. I ordered the potato knish and the broccoli knish. They were both tasteless to say the least. There was no seasoning, not much salt either. I know that they're known for their meaty sandwiches but I thought they would put some effort into their meatless offerings. They ought to just stick to the meat and leave the vegetarian food to the other vendors. It would save them from reviews like this. On a positive note, the cashier was friendly and the knishes were ready in 5 minutes. I have to say that I will not be patronizing this venue anytime soon or maybe ever.
Delicious food.

Finally made it to Albee Sq( oops, named changed) lol. City Pointe to order sandwich for my Sister who now lives In NC. Omg!! She said there is nothing like an Katz's corn beef. She is now looking to get one whenever we go south😁😁😁
20 bucks for a sandwich in a self serve food court, no wonder the staff is bored hence barely customers

Katz's deli is NewYork institution on the lower East side of Manhattan. This satellite location is a great representation of the original with over-stuffed sandwiches, fresh ingredients and cool atmosphere.  Don't miss out on a great pastrami sandwich or corned beef.  Better yet have a combo sandwich and enjoy.  A must try if you are in the Dekalb Market.
Just as good as the original without having to go to Manhattan. Walk around the market, grab a beer and enjoy an awesome pastrami sandwich. Pickles on the side of course.

Katz's deli is a must stop place for pastrami lovers. Every time I visit New York I like to stop by for one of their world famous pastrami sandwiches.  The pastrami is melt in your mouth good and is by far the best one I have ever had.  They do their ordering a little funky through separate lines and the place can get super busy, but it's worth the wait
The sandwiches are out of this world delicious from start to finish I love the mix sandwich of pastrami and brisket on hero or rye you can't go wrong

I decided to pay the Brooklyn location a visit seeing as it's close to where I work. I ordered a roast beef sandwich and a few knishes. Sooo good!  It may seem expensive at first but the amount of meat that's on that sandwich, Wow! I had a half for lunch and the other half for dinner!  The guys and also a lady that helped at the register were awesome as well. I'll be back for sure.  Thanks, Brooklyn Kats for an awesome and tasty experience.
Pastrami Reuben sandwich was dry and very chewy. The restaurant in Manhattan good much better.

Severely over priced. What's with the tipping?! You are not bringing the food to me ... I have been dying for a pastrami sandwich and  it left much to be desired. Super dry. I don't know what they burnt in the oil but the fries and potato latkes had a weird after taste. For 2 sandwiches, received 2 mustards asked for more, received 1 more for $85 they should have given me at least 4 without asking! Very disappointed 😔

Shining example of why institutions like Katz's should NEVER expand. In particular, they should NEVER EVER EVER expand to a place like a food court. Invariably the food takes a major hit and that's exactly what happened here. Ordered a pastrami on rye. That's as basic as it gets in the Katz's universe and what did I get? A sinew and grizzle filled sandwich that wasn't even sliced properly. I couldn't even finish it. And I know that if I was at the counter at the original location, speaking to the person making my sandwich, maybe even getting a couple of slices as a pre-game taste, may be even tipping that person at the counter, there is NO CHANCE I would have received the same sub-par pastrami that I got in the food court location. QUALITY CONTROL is the number one thing when expanding. SHAMEFUL. Shame on you Katz's - I expected much better from you!
Sandwich is good but well overpriced. I think it's pretty good but it's a tourist trap. That being said I would eat it again if someone else paid for it.

Corned beef was really dry, and they got my order wrong. Overpriced. Also, they ask you for a tip of either 5, 10 or 15 percent as you are placing your order, so you might wonder if not tipping means a 'sad' sandwich. I'll gladly tip well in a restaurant and, of course, after a meal not before, so I find this whole setup strange, but that's just me.
Very taste food. A must go
Great service, food, and prices on par with original.

Better than the original! The matzo ball soup was wonderful, the pastrami was great and the brisket was amazing. Sandwiches all come with a side of mustard and pickles. Much nicer staff, sandwiches are prepared at a ridiculous speed (very efficient). Same high price but huge portion as the original too. The menu here is pared down (nothing is sold by the pound), but the favorite items are there.
Food is almost as good as the original location. The staff is nice. Don't be surprised because it's still pricey.
Finally in Brooklyn!!!!!
